@kimcs It happens because there's a brief disconnection during the seek. 

The disconnect is ultimately not necessary, and it's being removed as part of #5022.

To clarify, the current behavior is that the consumer gets disconnected and internally the client library will automatically reconnect. 

In your test above, the unsubscribe actually happens before the client lib had the chance to reconnect.

@Jennifer88huang @Monica-zy : 

It is already documented: http://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/security-token-client/ and http://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/security-token-admin/
@otmanel31 how do you build your NIFI processor? what are the dependencies you are using?
@borlandor I don't think c++ client provides natively support on schemas on c++ structs. I believe you have to serialize the c++ structs using AVRO or JSON.

> Expected is that it will return only after the delayed publishing is actually done. Or is my understanding wrong?...

@lorraine1 the delay applies to delivering message to the consumer. it doesn't 'delay' at producing.

@Muyoo connection already closed doesn't mean your docker has any problem. It just means at the time you created producer, the connection from your cllient to broker is already closed. I don't believe it is related to docker version.
@david-streamlio can you please help @otmanel31 with his issue?
@otmanel31 I think you'd better to create an issue on streamlio/nifi-pulsar-bundle repo. because the ASF doesn't own that repo. you should contact the repo owner to get direct support over there
@ppgoml yes it is a problem from java's URI
This fixed by #4184

@david-streamlio Thank you very much.

Some colleagues using the pulsar cluster got it reach the same state.

What I can see is again for a topic replicated between (4) different regions.

Looking at each region individually, in local ZK, I can see the same data for znode `/namespace/<mytenant>/<mynamespace>` children on all zk instances (zk-0, zk-1, zk-2). But looking at the global picture, data is different between regions (2 regions have no child znodes, one region has 121 children, the other one 128 children).

Children to `/namespace/<mytenant>/<mynamespace>` are like :
```
[0x32000000_0x34000000, 0x54000000_0x56000000, 0x08000000_0x0a000000, 0xb8000000_0xba000000, 0x76000000_0x78000000, 0xc1ffffff_0xc3ffffff, 0x6e000000_0x70000000,
```
and have no sub child.

The global zookeeper has no `/namespace` znode.

What I noticed on global zk is that:
- some zk instances are missing the `/admin` znode 
- the instance that have `/admin/policies/session/user_events` missing are all the "observer" nodes and some others
- since some nodes do not have the `/admin` znode, then they do not have the `/admin/policies/<mytenant>/<mynamespace>` znode and content

@yittg  Great work!

Left few comments:
1. I think use `CommandGetOrCreateSchema` and `CommandGetOrCreateSchemaResponse`  is more suitable.
2. Similar to the reader cache, the writer cache can be handled in the same way.
3. Need to consider the batch message, messages of different schema versions cannot be contained in a batch.

For writing documentation, refer to different `Client libraries` at http://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/client-libraries-java/
